title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.21 Part 1 | 23-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Gyanathimirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from 21st verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This will be part 1 of this verse which will be discussed.
Dhanvinam Agraneer Esha Tulyas Charjunayor Dwayoho
Hutasha Iva Durdharsaha Samudra Iva Dustaraha
The meaning of this verse is amongst great bowmen this child will be as good as Arjuna.
He will be as irresistible as fire and as fire.
So three comparisons are made in this verse.
He will be a great bowman like Arjuna.
And specifically there is mention of two Arjunas here.
Prabhupada mentions in the purport in history there are two famous Arjunas.
Who was the king of Haihaya.
And the other Arjuna is the famous grandfather of King Pariksit.
Both the Arjunas are famous for their bowmanship.
And the child Pariksit is foretold to be equal to both of them particularly in fighting.
To subdue the miscreants to protect the innocent to give protection to the brahmanas the women the children the saintly persons.
Otherwise if the king is not powerful enough then these miscreants and rogues and ruffians and thieves will plunder and loot from the innocent.
So Pariksit is foretold to be equal to both these Arjunas who are very very very powerful in fighting.
Now Srila Prabhupada gives a description of Pandava Arjuna.
The Arjuna who is the grandfather of this Pariksit.
In this way Pandava Arjuna is the grandfather of Pariksit.
So Prabhupada mentions Pandava Arjuna is the great hero of the Bhagavad Gita.
Bhagavad Gita was spoken by Krishna to Arjuna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra.
And that's how we know Bhagavad Gita as the most famous scripture.
It gives us the essence of the Vedic wisdom.
Arjuna is the kshatriya son of Maharaj.
Arjuna is the son of Pandu.
Queen Kunti Devi could call for any one of the demigods.
Because Kunti could not beget children through Pandu.
So it is allowed in the former ages.
Can beget children through the husband's brother.
If the husband is unable to conceive children in his own wife.
So this is called Devarayana Sutodhpakti.
And this is prohibited in Kali Yuga.
But they were, Kunti and Pandu were living in.
She had one mantra given by Durvasamuni.
And thus she could call any one of the devatas.
A plenary part of the heavenly king Indra.
Arjuna is not an ordinary person.
He was born in the month of Phalguna.
Therefore he is also called Phalguni.
When he appeared as the son of Kunti.
His future greatness is proclaimed by air messages.
This is the fame of Arjuna.
Even at the time of his birth.
From different parts of the universe.
By their heavenly dances and songs.
And the maternal uncle of Arjuna.
In the presence of the Rishis.
From whom he got four sons.
One each from each of the wives.
Arjuna had a son by name Shrutakirti.
Abhimanyu died in the battle of Kurukshetra.
So he had four sons through four wives.
So that's how it has happened.
Arjuna lost his life in the battle of Power.
Arjuna lost his life in the battle of Power.
by his disciplinary affection. Dronacharya accepted Arjuna as a first
grade scholar and he loved heartily to bestow upon Arjuna all the blessings of
military signs. Now how studious was Arjuna that's described here. Arjuna was
so ardent a student that he used to practice bowmanship even at night and
for all these reasons professor Dronacharya was determined to make him
the topmost bowman of the entire world. At night he would practice the lessons
taught by the teacher Dronacharya in the daytime.
So, he was very, very studious, very sincere in his Gurukul days. He passed very brilliantly the examination in piercing the target and Dronacharya was very pleased.

So, this was the expertise of Arjuna in bhavanship. He learnt from Dronacharya very nicely. Then regarding Arjuna's son Babruvahana, Srila Prabhupada says, royal families at Manipur and Tripura are descendants of Arjuna's son Babruvahana.
So, present day the royal families at Manipur and Tripura are descendants of Arjuna's son Babruvahana.
Arjuna saved the Acharya, that is Dronacharya, from the attack of a crocodile and Dronacharya being pleased with him, rewarded him with a weapon of the name Brahma Shira.
Many of these weapons are very, very powerful weapons.
And unless one learns them from a proper guru, one will be unable to use those weapons.
And many of them are mantra weapons.
So, the perfect chanting of the mantra as heard from the expert spiritual master only will enable a student to learn that in such a way that he can use that.
So, the perfect chanting of the mantra as heard from the expert spiritual master only will enable a student to learn that in such a way that he can use that.
Now Maharaja Drupada, Draupadi's father, was inimical toward Dronacharya.
Now Maharaja Drupada, Draupadi's father, was inimical toward Dronacharya.
And when Kraja Què kept Drupada back in theliar, she Lunchio Act, Arjuna arrested him and brought him to Dronacharya.
And when Kraja 마스�o attacked Dhenup there, Arjuna said to Brahmacarya, you can let your father go to Dronacharya, one who has defeated the 20 million Turks.
Shacy, son of Bhavani, imprisoned him in the他們 monastery scrape mon sargahaDav was şöyle said by Arjuna.
So, then it is also mentioned that Arjuna besieged a city of the name Ahichatra, belonging to Maharaj Drupada and after taking it over, he gave it to Dronacharya.

The confidential treatment of the weapon Brahma Shira was explained to Arjuna and Dronacharya was promised by Arjuna that he would use the weapon if necessary when Dronacharya personally became an enemy of Arjuna.
In this way, Dronacharya forecasted the future battle of Kurukshetra in which Dronacharya was going to fight.

Dronacharya was on the opposite side of Arjuna. See, the Acharya is teaching a student and he is able to foresee the future and for the sake of Arjuna to become victorious in the battle of Kurukshetra against the Kauravas, Dronacharya is teaching him in the student days, this particular Brahma Shira.
So, Arjuna can use this weapon to win against the Kauravas and he can even use that to kill Dronacharya himself.
So, what is the secret understanding?
his student a particular astra how to use which the student will use against
the teacher himself so these are all extraordinary incidents described in the

so that is the principle we have to understand why Dronacharya was willing to
